definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
to walk (side part of split character)
to break the rules/to violate regulations
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
to break a promise/to violate an agreement/to default (on a loan or contract)
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
(haven't done sth) for a long time/a long time since we last met
to violate a prohibition or ban/prohibited/illicit
things turn out contrary to the way one wishes (idiom)
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
false/untrue to one's convictions/against one's will/disloyal

sentences.english: This is a bad design practice that runs counter to our internal design guidelines.
sentences.chinese: 這是違揹我們內部設計指導方針的不好的設計實踐。

sentences.english: Without my blessing, not a leaf will fall.
sentences.chinese: 沒有葉子會違揹我的旨意飄落。

sentences.english: Although difficult to breach destiny, but since someone always illegal.
sentences.chinese: 天命雖難違，奈何總有人要違。

sentences.english: Although difficult to breach destiny, but since someone always illegal.
sentences.chinese: 天命雖難違，奈何總有人要違。

sentences.english: How can the opposite often result?
Do you think this act of the Chinese Government is against the humanitarian spirit?
sentences.chinese: 你是否認爲中國政府此舉違揹人道主義精神？

sentences.english: Lovesickness is a condition brought upon us, against our will, by a force somehow external to us.
sentences.chinese: 相思病是被外力違揹我們的意志強加於身上的。

sentences.english: It never violates the laws of physics.
sentences.chinese: 它從不違揹物理學定律。

sentences.english: To tell even a little fib gose against my grain.
sentences.chinese: 即使撒點小謊，也違揹我的個性。

sentences.english: This action goes against my conscience.
sentences.chinese: 這一行動違揹我的良心。

sentences.english: Insolation wind screens to shake Fei, Chun Hong Lo hand swab things illegal.
sentences.chinese: 日射紗窗風撼扉，香羅拭手春事違。

sentences.english: You don't have to behave in ways that go against your personality or temperament.
sentences.chinese: 你只須做回你自己，毋須違揹你一貫的性格或性情。

definition: (conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
